{"metadata":{"objective":"Body paragraphs for an essay","lastStepAudioPath":"summary","audioPath":"CS16/7/Refresher"},"steps":[{"headerText":"","leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-cktitle\" style=\"color:#025B5B;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:22px;font-weight:bold;\">A paragraph is not enough!</span><br /><br />You keep remembering how bad your visit to the Gravel Mountain Motel was, and you decide&nbsp;to add more to your letter.<br /><br />You make a list of more complaints&nbsp;and realize that you need to use a different approach to organizing your thoughts. You need to&nbsp;fit more information into your letter.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"ju-arch-daughter\" style=\"font-family:architects daughter,serif;font-size:15px;\">And furthermore. . .</span><br /><br /><span class=\"ju-arch-daughter\" style=\"font-family:architects daughter,serif;font-size:15px;\">The room was small and crowded.<br />The beds were uncomfortable.<br />The plumbing was outdated and worn out.<br />The shower was only a trickle of cold water.<br />The sink would not stop dripping.<br />The breakfast buffet was lukewarm.<br />Most of the breakfast food was gone by 7 a.m.<br />The person at the desk was texting on his phone when I arrived.<br />Then he began adjusting the volume on the music that was playing in the lobby.<br />When I asked if he could help us, he told me he was going off duty, and someone else would arrive pretty soon.</span></p></td></tr></tbody></table>","settings":{"showHeader":0,"showAudio":1,"audioPath":"1","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0"}},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"2"},"leftText":"<p>When you have a lot to say, you need to write a longer piece of writing, such as an essay.<br /><br />A longer piece of writing includes an introduction, a conclusion, and body paragraphs.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <img alt=\"A diagram shows the parts of a longer piece of writing: the introductory paragraph, 3 body paragraphs, and the concluding paragraph.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Structuring a longer piece of writing"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"3"},"leftText":"<p>When you are&nbsp;writing one paragraph, the single paragraph contains all the needed parts: a topic sentence to introduce what you are writing about, details, and a concluding sentence.<br /><br />In a longer piece of writing, the introductory paragraph introduces what you are writing about;&nbsp;supporting details go&nbsp;in one or more&nbsp;body paragraphs;&nbsp;and the concluding sentence goes in&nbsp;a concluding paragraph.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows how the 3 parts of a paragraph correspond to the parts of a longer piece of writing.  A paragraph's topic sentence corresponds to a longer piece of writing's introductory paragraph.  A paragraph's supporting details correspond to the body paragraphs of a longer piece of writing. A paragraph's concluding sentence corresponds to a longer piece of writing's concluding paragraph. \" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"4"},"leftText":"<p>The module <em>Writing to Win</em> &nbsp;explains how to write a five paragraph essay including details about writing an introductory paragraph and a conclusion.<br /><br />This mini-lesson covers the differences between a single, standalone paragraph, such as your original complaint letter to the Gravel Mountain Motel, and the body paragraphs of a longer piece of writing, such as the longer letter you are now planning to write!<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"5"},"leftText":"<p>In a longer piece of writing, you use body paragraphs to organize, develop, and share&nbsp;your ideas.<br /><br />Each body paragraph is part of the whole and covers a single point, or idea. &nbsp;<br /><br />Each body paragraph has&nbsp;a topic sentence that describes the idea&nbsp;and details that support the topic sentence.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <img alt=\"A diagram shows the 2 parts of a body paragraph in a longer piece of writing.  The first part is the topic sentence for a single idea. The 2nd part is the supporting details for the topic sentence.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":"Body paragraphs"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"6"},"leftText":"<p>In a standalone paragraph, the topic sentence names the topic and the main idea and gives&nbsp;the reader information about the writer&#39;s plan.<br /><br />In your original letter to the Gravel Mountain Motel, which had only one paragraph,&nbsp;the topic sentence named&nbsp;the two areas that you wanted to talk about: the poor quality of the motel&nbsp;and the&nbsp;poor service.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Original letter with two ideas in the topic sentence:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><span style=\"line-height: 20.8px;\"><strong>My stay at your motel on October 15, 2015 was a terrible experience for my family and me because of the <span class=\"marker\">poor quality of the motel</span> and the <span class=\"marker\">poor service.</span></strong><strong> </strong>The walls were thin, and we could hear people in the hallways singing and laughing until 2:00 a.m.&nbsp; Additionally,&nbsp; we tried to watch a movie, and the TV did not work. . . </span></td></tr></tbody></table>","headerText":"Topic sentence for a body paragraph"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"7"},"leftText":"<p>In a body paragraph that is part of a longer piece of writing, the topic sentence names one idea of several that the writer will write about. The other ideas will appear in their own paragraphs.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"A diagram shows how the ideas in the topic sentence of a standalone paragraph correspond to a longer piece of writing. Each idea from the topic sentence of a standalone paragraph becomes it's own topic sentence for a body paragraph in a longer piece of writing.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"8"},"leftText":"<p>In&nbsp;your new expanded letter, the topic of the first body paragraph will be&nbsp;the poor quality of everything at the motel.<br /><br />This organization gives you an entire paragraph to write about problems with the motel&rsquo;s quality, so&nbsp;you can include all the details on your list.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">First body paragraph of the expanded letter with a single idea in the topic sentence:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><strong>The first thing&nbsp;that made our stay so terrible&nbsp;was the<span class=\"marker\"> poor quality of everything&nbsp;in the motel</span></strong>.&nbsp; The room was small and crowded, and the beds were uncomfortable. The plumbing was outdated and worn out, with a shower that was only a trickle of cold water and a sink faucet that would not stop dripping.&nbsp; Finally, the breakfast buffet was lukewarm, and was depleted of most breakfast food by 7 a.m.&nbsp;</p></td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"9"},"leftText":"<p>In the second body paragraph of your expanded letter, the topic is the poor service at the Gravel Mountain Motel.<br /><br />Now you can write a whole paragraph explaining the poor service.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Second body paragraph of the expanded letter with a single idea in the topic sentence:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><strong>The next thing I noticed about your motel was the <span class=\"marker\">poor service</span>.</strong>&nbsp; When we called the main desk, no one answered, so we walked down to the lobby, and the young man there showed no interest in helping us solve our problems.&nbsp; He was texting on his phone when I arrived.&nbsp; He took his sweet time finishing texting!&nbsp; Then, as I waited patiently, he began adjusting the volume on the music that was playing in the lobby.&nbsp; When I asked if he could help us, he said, &quot;Why don&#39;t you fix the TV yourselves?&quot;&nbsp; Finally, he told us he was going off duty, and someone else would arrive pretty soon.&nbsp; With that, he strolled out the door.</p></td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"10"},"leftText":"<p>Body paragraphs should include enough supporting details to be convincing and should stick to the topic. &nbsp;&nbsp; Many writers include at least three pieces of support when planning an effective paragraph.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"11"},"leftText":"<p>A single paragraph uses&nbsp;transition words to help the reader understand the writer&#39;s plan and connect ideas clearly.&nbsp;<span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\"> In your original letter, you used the transition words &quot;additionally&quot; and &quot;worst of all.&quot;</span><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Transition words in your original letter:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td>My stay at your motel on October 15, 2015 was a terrible experience for my family and me because of the poor quality of the motel and the poor service.&nbsp; The walls were thin, and we could hear people in the hallways singing and laughing until 2:00 a.m.&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">Additionally</span>,&nbsp; we tried to watch a movie, and the TV did not work, giving us an error message that said, &quot;Please contact the main desk to resolve problem.&quot;&nbsp; <span class=\"marker\">Worst of all</span>, when we called the main desk, no one answered, so we walked down to the lobby, and the young man there showed no interest in helping us solve our problems.&nbsp; Instead he told us, &quot;Why don&#39;t you fix the TV yourselves?&quot;&nbsp; For these reasons, the night I spent at the Gravel Mountain Motel was the most unpleasant vacation experience I have ever had.</td></tr></tbody></table>","headerText":"Transition words in a body paragraph"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"12"},"leftText":"<p>When you include transition words in a longer piece of writing, you often use them&nbsp;at the beginning of each paragraph as well as within the paragraph.<br /><br />You can use the same transition words that you use in a standalone paragraph to let your reader understand the order in which events happened or the&nbsp;order of importance of the paragraphs.&nbsp;<br /><br />You add transition words to the beginning of each body paragraph in your expanded letter.&nbsp; <span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">The first paragraph starts with &quot;The first thing,&quot; and the second paragraph starts with &quot;The next thing.&quot;</span><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Transition words at the beginning of paragraphs in the expanded letter:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p><span class=\"marker\">The first thing</span> that made our stay so terrible was the&nbsp;poor quality of everything in the motel. The room was small and crowded, and the beds were uncomfortable. The plumbing was outdated and worn out, with a shower that was only a trickle of cold water and a sink faucet that would not stop dripping. Finally, the breakfast buffet was lukewarm, and was depleted of most breakfast food by 7 a.m.&nbsp;</p><p><span class=\"marker\">The next thing</span> I noticed about your motel was the poor service.&nbsp; When we called the main desk, no one answered, so we walked down to the lobby, and the young man there showed no interest in helping us solve our problems.&nbsp; He was texting on his phone when I arrived.&nbsp; He took his sweet time finishing texting!&nbsp; Then, as I waited patiently, he began adjusting the volume on the music that was playing in the lobby.&nbsp; When I asked if he could help us, he said, &quot;Why don&#39;t you fix the TV yourselves?&quot;&nbsp; Finally, he told us he was going off duty, and someone else would arrive pretty soon.&nbsp; With that, he strolled out the door.</p></td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"13"},"leftText":"<p>The concluding sentence in a standalone paragraph summarizes the entire paragraph.&nbsp; <span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">In your original letter it was &quot;For these reasons, the night I spent at the Gravel Mountain Motel was the most unpleasant vacation experience I have ever had.&quot;</span><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Concluding sentence in the original letter:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><span style=\"line-height: 20.8px;\">My stay at your motel on October 15, 2015 was a terrible experience for my family and me because of the poor quality of the motel and the poor service.&nbsp;The walls were thin, and we could hear people in the hallways singing and laughing until 2:00 a.m.&nbsp; Additionally,&nbsp; we tried to watch a movie, and the TV did not work, giving us an error message that said, &quot;Please contact the main desk to resolve problem.&quot;&nbsp; Worst of all, when we called the main desk, no one answered, so we walked down to the lobby, and the young man there showed no interest in helping us solve our problems. Instead he told us, &quot;Why don&#39;t you fix the TV yourselves?&quot; <span class=\"marker\">For these reasons, the night I spent at the Gravel Mountain Motel was the most unpleasant vacation experience I have ever had.</span></span></td></tr></tbody></table>","headerText":"Concluding sentence for a body paragraph"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"14"},"leftText":"<p>A body paragraph does not need a concluding sentence.&nbsp; It is part of a longer piece of writing that includes a full paragraph as a conclusion.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <img alt=\"A diagram shows the 2 parts of a body paragraph in a longer piece of writing.  The first part is the topic sentence for a single idea. The 2nd part is the supporting details for the topic sentence.  It does not include a conclusion because the conclusion forms its own paragraph.\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","headerText":""},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"15"},"leftText":"<p>The body paragraphs in your expanded letter do not need concluding sentences.&nbsp;&nbsp; The first drafts are done!<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"16"},"leftText":"<p>Your next step is to revise your paragraphs.&nbsp; When you are revising, make sure&nbsp;each&nbsp;body paragraph meets these&nbsp;criteria:</p><ul style=\"padding-left: 15px;\"><li>covers just one of the ideas that is mentioned in the introductory paragraph</li><li>starts with a topic sentence that names the idea</li><li>has enough details to support the topic sentence</li><li>includes details that all stick to to the topic</li><li>transitions smoothly from the paragraph before it<br />&nbsp;</li></ul>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">First body paragraph draft:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>The first thing that made our stay so terrible was the poor quality of everything in the motel. &nbsp;The room was small and crowded, and the beds were uncomfortable. The plumbing was outdated and worn out, with a shower that was only a trickle of cold water and a sink faucet that would not stop dripping.&nbsp; Finally, the breakfast buffet was lukewarm, and was depleted of most breakfast food by 7 a.m.&nbsp;</p></td></tr></tbody></table>","headerText":"Revising a body paragraph"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"17"},"leftText":"<p>When you review the first body paragraph, you decide that it meets the criteria, but that you have forgotten to include the details <span class=\"screen-reader-only\" style=\"background-color:#FA839F;\">about the thin walls, people laughing and singing in the hallways until 2:00 a.m., and the TV not working </span>from your original letter!&nbsp;<br /><br />You add those details.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">First body paragraph with additional details:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td>The first thing that made our stay so terrible was the poor quality of everything in the motel.&nbsp;&nbsp;<span class=\"marker\">The walls were thin, and we could hear people in the hallways singing and laughing until 2:00 a.m.&nbsp; Additionally, we tried to watch a movie, and the TV did not work, giving us an error message that said, &quot;Please contact the main desk to resolve problem.&quot;</span>&nbsp; The room was small and crowded, and the beds were uncomfortable.&nbsp; The plumbing was outdated and worn out, with a shower that was only a trickle of cold water and a sink faucet that would not stop dripping.&nbsp; Finally, the breakfast buffet was lukewarm, and was depleted of most breakfast food by 7 a.m.&nbsp;</td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"18"},"leftText":"<p>The second body paragraph meets the criteria too!&nbsp;&nbsp;<br /><br />You don&#39;t make any changes to this paragraph.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Second body paragraph:</span></p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain\" style=\"width: 100%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>The next thing I noticed about your motel was the poor service.&nbsp; When we called the main desk, no one answered, so we walked down to the lobby, and the young man there showed no interest in helping us solve our problems.&nbsp; He was texting on his phone when I arrived.&nbsp; He took his sweet time finishing texting!&nbsp; Then, as I waited patiently, he began adjusting the volume on the music that was playing in the lobby.&nbsp; When I asked if he could help us, he said, &quot;Why don&#39;t you fix the TV yourselves?&quot;&nbsp; Finally, he told us he was going off duty, and someone else would arrive pretty soon.&nbsp; With that, he strolled out the door.</p></td></tr></tbody></table>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"19"},"leftText":"<p>Your expanded letter now includes a body paragraph for each topic and plenty of details to make your complaints convincing.<br /><br />You add an introductory paragraph and a conclusion and send it off!&nbsp; Not only do you get an apology from the manager of the Gravel Mountain Motel, but you get a complete refund.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":0,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"audioPath":"20"},"leftText":"<p>There are key&nbsp;differences between a single, standalone paragraph and a group of&nbsp;body paragraphs for&nbsp;an essay or longer piece of writing.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p><table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-table\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">&nbsp;</th><th scope=\"col\"><strong>Standalone paragraph</strong></th><th scope=\"col\"><strong>Body paragraph</strong></th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><strong>Topic sentence</strong></td><td>gives the topic and main idea, and includes details that let the reader know the writer&#39;s plan</td><td>gives a single idea</td></tr><tr><td><strong>Transition words</strong></td><td>tell the order or importance of ideas within the paragraph</td><td>also provide smooth transitions between paragraphs</td></tr><tr><td><strong>Concluding sentence</strong></td><td>summarizes the paragraph</td><td>not needed</td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null,"headerText":"Putting it all together"},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0},"leftText":"<table border=\"0\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-summary\" style=\"width:90%;\"><thead><tr><th scope=\"col\">Remember!</th></tr></thead><tbody><tr><td><p>A body paragraph should meet these criteria:</p><ul><li>covers&nbsp;just one of the ideas that is mentioned in the introductory paragraph</li><li>starts with a topic sentence that names the idea</li><li>has enough details to support the topic sentence</li><li>has details that&nbsp;stick to the topic</li><li>includes a smooth transition from the previous paragraph</li></ul></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":0,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0},"leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">One paragraph letter:</span></p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>Dear Gravel Mountain Motel Manager,</p><p>My stay at your motel on October 15, 2015 was a terrible experience for my family and me because of the poor quality of the motel and the poor service. The walls were thin, and we could hear people in the hallways singing and laughing until 2:00 a.m.&nbsp; Additionally,&nbsp; we tried to watch a movie, and the TV did not work, giving us an error message that said, &quot;Please contact the main desk to resolve problem.&quot;&nbsp; Worst of all, when we called the main desk, no one answered, so we walked down to the lobby, and the young man there showed no interest in helping us solve our problems. Instead he told us, &quot;Why don&#39;t you fix the TV yourselves?&quot; For these reasons, the night I spent at the Gravel Mountain Motel was the most unpleasant vacation experience I have ever had.</p><p>Please refund the cost of our hotel room as soon as possible.</p><p>Sincerely,<br />Ticked-off Traveler</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null},{"settings":{"showAudio":0,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":1,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0},"leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-labels\" style=\"color:#59595B;font-family:tahoma;font-weight:bold;\">Expanded letter:</span></p><table border=\"1\" cellpadding=\"1\" cellspacing=\"1\" class=\"ju-tableplain ju-tight\" style=\"width: 90%;\"><tbody><tr><td><p>Dear Gravel Mountain Motel Manager,</p><p>My stay at your motel on October 15, 2015 was a terrible experience for my family and me. We had planned on a relaxing evening after a long day of driving. Instead, we encountered a broken-down inn with the worst service imaginable.</p><p><span style=\"line-height: 20.8px;\">The first thing that made our stay so terrible was the poor quality of everything in the motel.</span>&nbsp; The walls were thin, and we could hear people in the hallways singing and laughing until 2:00 a.m.&nbsp; Additionally, we tried to watch a movie, and the TV did not work, giving us an error message that said, &quot;Please contact the main desk to resolve problem.&quot;&nbsp; The room was small and crowded, and the beds were uncomfortable.&nbsp; The plumbing was outdated and worn out, with a shower that was only a trickle of cold water and a sink faucet that would not stop dripping.&nbsp; Finally, the breakfast buffet was lukewarm and was depleted of most breakfast food by 7 a.m.&nbsp;</p><p>The next thing I noticed about your motel was the poor service. When we called the main desk, no one answered, so we walked down to the lobby, and the young man there showed no interest in helping us solve our problems He was texting on his phone when I arrived. He took his sweet time finishing texting! Then, as I waited patiently, he began adjusting the volume on the music that was playing in the lobby.&nbsp; When I asked if he could help us, he said, &quot;Why don&#39;t you fix the TV yourselves?&quot; Finally, he told us he was going off duty, and someone else would arrive pretty soon. With that, he strolled out the door.</p><p>As you can see, the night I spent at the Gravel Mountain Motel was the most unpleasant vacation experience I have ever had. The building itself and everything in it are not fit for humans, and the staff you employ have no idea how to serve the public. &nbsp;This letter should serve as a wake-up call.</p><p>Please refund the cost of our hotel room as soon as possible.</p><p>Sincerely,<br />Ticked-off Traveler</p><p>&nbsp;</p></td></tr></tbody></table><p>&nbsp;</p>","rightText":null}],"overviewHeader":"Overview"}
